Klasse Display

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
Display
public class Display extends greenfoot.Actor
The Display is a singleton that displays information in abox as a console.
Version:
28.09.2025
Autor:
Paul Jonas

    messagePriority
    The priority of messages is displayed

  • Felddetails

    • messagePriority

      public MessagePriority messagePriority
      The priority of messages is displayed

  • Methodendetails

    • getInstance

      public static Display getInstance(MessagePriority priority, greenfoot.World world)
      Returns the single instance of the Display class. If no instance exists, a new one is created.
      Parameter:
      priority - The minimum priority of messages to display.
      world - The world to add the display to.
      Gibt zurück:
      The single instance of the Display class.

    • getInstance

      public static Display getInstance(greenfoot.World world)
      Returns the single instance of the Display class. If no instance exists, a new one is created with the default priority of INFO.
      Parameter:
      world -
      Gibt zurück:
      The single instance of the Display class.

    • display

      public void display(String messageText)
      Clears the current text from the display and then writes the given text onto the display.
      Parameter:
      messageText - The text to write onto the display.

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Clears the text from the display

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      The display is removed from the world.

    • message

      public void message(String messageText, MessagePriority priority)
      Writes the given text onto the display if the priority is high enough. If the priority of the message is higher than the priority of the display, the text is not written. After writing the text, the method waits for 1 second and then clears the display.
      Parameter:
      messageText - The text to write onto the display.
      priority - The priority of the message. If the priority of the message is higher than the priority of the display, the text is not written.

    • message

      public void message(String messageText)
      Writes the given text onto the display with the default priority of INFO.
      Parameter:
      messageText - The text to write onto the display.
